byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

abstract: The corporation's independent shareholders voted largely against reinstating Rupert Murdoch's sons James and Lachlan to the company board, according to a tally.
snippet: The corporation's independent shareholders voted largely against reinstating Rupert Murdoch's sons James and Lachlan to the company board, according to a tally.
lead_paragraph: News Corporation's independent shareholders voted largely against reinstating Rupert Murdoch's sons James and Lachlan to the company board, according to a tally the company filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on Monday. Although the Murdoch family's control of a large percentage of voting shares all but guaranteed that all 15 board members would be re-elected after a contentious shareholder meeting on Friday, the detailed tally showed widespread opposition to the roles of James and Lachlan Murdoch.

headline.main: Murdoch's Sons Rebuked by News Corp. Shareholders
